name: Ike
description: Ike is your standard hard-hitter. He has slow attacks (except for his jab and dtilt) that hit hard and launch far. Although he lacks combos, he more than makes up with it with kill potential and damage (ala Ganon or Bowser).

combos.notes:
This combo was tested against the lightest character in each weight category. Characters who have smaller frames like Diddy Kong and Mega Man will have a lower percentage, normally by about 5%,

This combo was also tested by buffering the SH+aerial. You can extend combo damage range by changing up times between jumping.

I tested it this way to guarantee combo precision.

To perform this combo properly, you're going to want to dash into your opponent to be as close as possible. This makes it a decent mix up for Ike, as you normally want to space yourself further out. This is a good starter combo.

This combo will not confirm on Zelda or Mega Man; I don't know why.

This combo has been tested with all of the lightest characters in each weight category.

Tested with a level 3 CPU on high shuflle.

Combo does not confirm kills on stage.

Combo will stage spike if edge guarding at very edge.

Will place the opponent high on stage and allow for more follow up combos but gives them an easy DI out.

All percentages are guaranteed; no percentage was kept if it only worked sometimes.

Characters in weight classes with smaller frames such as Mr. Game and Watch, Squirtle, etc. may have lower percentages.
